column1: Adra is a town and a railway colony situated in the Raghunathpur subdivision of Purulia district in the Indian state of West Bengal. It was well known for its Anglo-Indian population. It is also an important town of north east Purulia. Adra is also known as a railway divisional headquarter of South Eastern Railways.
The major sub-divisions of Adra are Agradoot

column1: Adra is the divisional headquarters of the Adra division of South Eastern Railway. The economy of the town is driven by the presence of the railways there. It is one of the three important coal loading divisions (the other two being Bilaspur and Chakradharpur) which supply coal to power plants across India.

column4: Kharagpur on the Kolkata-Chennai and Kolkata-Mumbai lines
column5: and Gomoh on the Kolkata-Delhi line. The present station building was built in 1903.
